main event: A UFO sighting was reported on 1st October 1956 in Brooklyn, New York, observed by a civilian for around three to five minutes. The object was seen moving from the southwest to northwest before disappearing over the northwest horizon. The report suggests that the sighting was probably caused by an aircraft.
interesting points: The observation was recorded as ground-radar but no photographs were taken.
The conclusion indicated that the sighting was likely caused by an aircraft, possibly a balloon.
The unidentified object was described as round, white, and without a tail or wings.
The sighting was collaborated by sightings from the 74th St area in Brooklyn by a group of six people.
Weather and wind conditions at the time of the sighting were reported as clear with various wind speeds at different altitudes.
sighted object: round, white object without a tail or wings
witnesses: civilian and a group of six people
